info.name: Customize Website Colors
info.description: Forces all websites to use a dark grey background and light grey text for nighttime viewing by default, but you can use this to make all websites use the colors you want! Some things may stay the colors they are supposed to as Stylus' !important's don't take priority over the website's ones, an error in my opinion. If this style is enabled, colors will be hard to customize. Disable this before editing the foreground and background color.

options.label: No
options.value: *, div, span { background-color: /*[[bgcolor]]*/ !important; color: /*[[fgcolor]]*/ !important; filter: none !important; border-color: /*[[fgcolor]]*/ !important; box-shadow: inset 0 0 0 0 transparent !important; text-shadow: -1px -1px 0 /*[[fgcolor]]*/ !important; opacity: 1 !important; }

options.label: Yes
options.value: *, div, span { background: none /*[[bgcolor]]*/ !important; color: /*[[fgcolor]]*/ !important; filter: none !important; border-color: /*[[fgcolor]]*/ !important; box-shadow: inset 0 0 0 0 transparent !important; text-shadow: -1px -1px 0 /*[[fgcolor]]*/ !important; opacity: 1 !important; }

options.label: None
options.value: /* No borders are around scripted "buttons" and links. */

options.label: Dotted
options.value: a, a:hover, a:focus, a:selected, a:active, a:visited { border: 1px dotted /*[[fgcolor]]*/ !important; }

options.label: Solid
options.value: a, a:hover, a:focus, a:selected, a:active, a:visited { border: 1px solid /*[[fgcolor]]*/ !important; }
